arcade.patch.env.location

Class PatchLocationHex

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.patch.env.location.PatchLocation
      • arcade.patch.env.location.PatchLocationHex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Location

    public final class PatchLocationHex
extends PatchLocation
    Concrete implementation of PatchLocation for hexagonal Grid to a triangular Lattice.

    Grid coordinates are in terms of (u, v, w) and the Lattice coordinates are in (x, y). Hexagons are flat side up. Triangular Lattice subcoordinates are ordered 0 - 5, with 0 at the top center and going clockwise around. 

          -------
     / \ 0 / \
    / 5 \ / 1 \
    -----------
    \ 4 / \ 2 /
     \ / 3 \ /
      -------
    In (u, v, w) coordinates, only coordinates where u + v + w = 0 are valid. For simulations with DEPTH > 0 (3D simulations), each the hexagonal grid is offset in one of two directions relative to the triangular lattice. Therefore, each cell in a location has six neighboring locations in the same layer, three neighboring locations in the layer above, and three neighboring locations in the layer below. Simulations with DEPTH > 1 must have a MARGIN > 0, otherwise the offset location coordinates will be associated with lattice coordinates that are out of bounds of the array.

      • calculateChecks

        void calculateChecks()
        Updates the possible moves that can be made.

        Each direction of movement (+u, -u, +v, -v, +w, -w, +z, -z) is tracked by each bit within a byte.

        Specified by:

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.ArrayList<Location> getNeighbors()
        Gets the location of the neighbors to the current location.

        We check if a neighbor location is valid by comparing the movement checks byte with the neighbor location byte. Neighbor list includes the current location.

        Specified by:
        getNeighbors in class PatchLocation
        Returns:
        the list of neighbor locations

      • getPerimeter

        public double getPerimeter(double f)
        Calculates the perimeter of a cell occupying the location.

        Estimates the perimeter of cell occupying the hexagonal location. Volume fraction used to take fraction of the perimeter of the hexagon. If fraction is not 1 (i.e. at least two cells in the location), then two additional inner segments are added.

        Specified by:
        getPerimeter in class PatchLocation
        Parameters:
        f - the fraction of total volume
        Returns:
        the perimeter of the cell

      • updateConfigs

        public static void updateConfigs(PatchSeries series)
        Updates static configuration variables.

        Environment sizes are not set until the simulation series is created. Calculations for coordinates depend on these sizes, so the Location needs to be updated based on the series configuration.

        Parameters:
        series - the current simulation series
